Class AlternativeEditor

All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.core.runtime.IAdaptable, org.eclipse.core.runtime.IExecutableExtension, org.eclipse.ui.IEditorPart, org.eclipse.ui.IPartListener, org.eclipse.ui.ISaveablePart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart2, org.eclipse.ui.IWorkbenchPart3, org.eclipse.ui.part.IWorkbenchPartOrientation
public class AlternativeEditor
extends RationaleEditorBase

This class provides the editor for alternatives.

          This class provides caching features used when updating properties of an alternative remotely.

onUpdate

public void onUpdate(Alternative pElement,
                     RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Respond to changes which have been made to the alternative being edited. Also respond to new arguments created which are children of this alternative.

Parameters:
pElement - the alternative which generated the event
pEvent - the rationale update event which describes what caused the event to be generated.

editorType

public java.lang.Class editorType()
Description copied from class: RationaleEditorBase
Get The Class Object Of The Type Of RationaleElement This Editor Supports

Specified by:
editorType in class RationaleEditorBase
Returns:
a class object representing the only RationaleElement type that this editor can edit correctly.

getRationaleElement

public RationaleElement getRationaleElement()
Description copied from class: RationaleEditorBase
Get the rationale element that we are editing. Must be implemented by all subclasses.

Specified by:
getRationaleElement in class RationaleEditorBase

getAlternative

public Alternative getAlternative()
Returns:
the alternative which is the logical file of this editor

onRefreshForm

protected void onRefreshForm(RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Description copied from class: RationaleEditorBase
Update the fields of the editor with the most current version of that data. If data in the editor has been changed by the user that data is not expected to be changed.

Overrides:
onRefreshForm in class RationaleEditorBase
Parameters:
pEvent - the event which caused the editor to need refreshed. This argument must be valid.

refreshArguments

public void refreshArguments(RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Rebuild the listboxes containing the set of all children of the alternative being edited.

Parameters:
pEvent - the rationaleUpdateEvent which caused this function to be called. This argument may be null.

onForArgumentUpdate

public void onForArgumentUpdate(Argument pElement,
                                RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Respond to events generated by an argument which is for the alternative being edited.

Parameters:
pElement - the argument which generated the event
pEvent - a description of what changes were made to the argument

onAgainstArgumentUpdate

public void onAgainstArgumentUpdate(Argument pElement,
                                    RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Respond to events generated by an argument which is against the alternative being edited.

Parameters:
pElement - the argument which generated the event
pEvent - a description of what changes were made to the argument

onRelationshipUpdate

                                 RationaleUpdateEvent pEvent)
Respond to events generated by an argument which is related but not strictly for or against the alternative being edited.

Parameters:
pElement - the argument which generated the event
pEvent - a description of what changes were made to the argument

updateFormCache

protected void updateFormCache()
Description copied from class: RationaleEditorBase
Called after each save to ensure the editors cache is correctly updated to indicate the values most recently saved.

Overrides:
updateFormCache in class RationaleEditorBase

saveData

public boolean saveData()
Description copied from class: RationaleEditorBase
This function is used to save form information to the database, it is called every time the form is saved, regardless of whether the element is being created or just being modified. Implementations should return true after the call to the database and return false at the end of the method (to handle multiple cases where a save might be invalid).

Specified by:
saveData in class RationaleEditorBase

showQuestion

private boolean showQuestion(java.lang.String message)
Used to ask the user questions when saving the alternative. These could be status questions (to supply a history) or ask for confirmation if they try to select a previously rejected alternative

Parameters:
message -
Returns:
the response to the dialog
